result.execSummary:
The defendant Geilan R Schreurs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft-Intent. Take >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the two, if not fully engaged then GFE to obtain status.
No contact with Walmart, J.W., & R.W.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Geilan R Schreurs

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CF1231, 15CF1048 called: 2:58pm
State appears by ADA C.Minder; Defendant appears in person and with Atty Jackan.

Parties state agreement as to restitution.
COURT questions defendant re: agreement.

COURT ORDERS: RESTITUTION as follows (to be paid through PO)>>
15CF1048>> $8,786.31 to Walmart 
15CF1231>> $5708.68 to J.W. 
>>All to be paid in payments of at least $160 per month

Atty Jackan requests cell phone seized in cases be returned to defendant; Argument by State; COURT ORDERS return of cell phone and laptop within 6 months.

Adj: 3:02pm
Restitution hearing on July 8, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
w/ Alternative Pre sentence Investigation report

Clerk Charli.
Case Called: 3:17 p.m.
INCLUDES: 15CF1048 & 15CF1231
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Deft appears, in person, with Atty Kat Jackan.
Victim Impact Statement Filed; 

ADA Minder addresses PSI; Making corrections as stated on record.
Atty Jackan makes correction to PSI.
Arguments;
ADA Minder notes Restitution Hearing will be needed. 

COURT ORDERS: 
15CF1048
Ct. 1- I/S 8 years (5 years IC & 3 years ES) to run concurrent; 8 years probation to run concurrent with 15CF1231; CONDITIONS: No Contact with Walmart, J.W. AND R.W; Maintain fulltime employment/schooling or combination of the two, if not fully engaged, GFE to obtain status; Restitution; CC;

15CF1231
Ct. 1 & Ct. 5- I/S 8 years (5 years IC & 3 years ES); 8 years probation to run concurrent with 15CF1048; CONDITIONS: 10 months MCJ; No Contact with Walmart, J.W. AND R.W; Maintain fulltime employment/schooling or combination of the two, if not fully engaged, GFE to obtain status; Restitution; CC;
Ct. 8 & Ct. 9- I/S 8 years (5 years IC & 3 years ES); 8 years probation to run concurrent with 15CF1048;  CONDITIONS: No Contact with Walmart, J.W. AND R.W; Maintain fulltime employment/schooling or combination of the two, if not fully engaged, GFE to obtain status; Restitution; CC;

COURT notes 148 days credit in 15CF1231.
COURT notes 1 day credit in 15CF1048 if revoked.
COURT notes Deft is NOT eligible for programming. 


CC: 05/26/2016 @ 1:00 p.m. with JA to set Restitution Hearing.
ADJ: 4:30 p.m.

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CF1048 and 15CF1231 called: 10:50am
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Austin Mort.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

15CF1231 - Cts. 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, 10-15>>All D&RI

PLEA:

15CF1231 - Ct. 5 (Burglary/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST
15CF1231 - Ct. 8 (Felony ID Theft/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST

15CF1048 - Ct. 1 (Felony Retail Theft/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST

Bond continues

Plea hearing at 03-03-2016 10:45 am.
Sentencing hearing at 05-24-2016 02:30 pm.

C: Br. 4

Pre-trial conference at 11-20-2015 08:55 am.
Preliminary Hearing at 11-23-2015 09:50 am.
Pre-trial conference at 12-08-2015 10:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): Walmart (any). Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Curfew: 10pm to 6am. Defendant must be at his home between those hours on a daily basis. Defendant must keep COC office up to date on address.
